PageTitle: peer substitute-as (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer substitute-as command enables AS number substitution in the advertisement direction. That is, the AS number of a specified peer group in the AS_Path attribute is replaced with the local AS number.
The undo peer substitute-as command disables AS number substitution. The peer substitute-as command enables AS number substitution in the advertisement direction. That is, the AS number of a specified peer group in the AS_Path attribute is replaced with the local AS number. The undo peer substitute-as command disables AS number substitution. By default, AS number substitution is disabled.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BGP peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: In a BGP public network scenario, when two devices with the same AS number learn a BGP route from each other through the same EBGP peer, the route may be discarded because the AS_Path attribute contains duplicate AS numbers. To prevent this problem, run the peer substitute-as command on this EBGP peer to enable AS number substitution in the advertisement direction.
